panels.content: ###### This dashboard displays uptime and downtime data for the hosts, high availability virtual machines and all virtual machines in the selected cluster.

panels.description: The average unplanned downtime per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- SL01-1 - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.

-- Unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            samples.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN samples.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN samples.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM 
                ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        samples.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            samples.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- SL01-1 - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.

-- Unplanned downtime
SELECT
    cluster_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) / AVG ( total ) AS unplanned_downtime
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM 
                ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY cluster_id, name, delete_date
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

panels.title: Downtime by Cluster (SL01-3)

panels.description: The average planned and unplanned downtime, and total time for each host per cluster.

targets.rawSql:
-- SL01-4 - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    CASE
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
            THEN 'No'
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN 'Yes'
    END AS is_deleted,
    host_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    host_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total

                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date,
            samples.host_id
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    host_id,
    cluster_id, 
    name, 
    delete_date, 
    host_name
ORDER BY
    (
        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- SL01-4 - This query returns the
-- average planned and unplanned downtime,
-- average uptime and total time per cluster.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    CASE
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL
            THEN 'No'
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN 'Yes'
    END AS is_deleted,
    host_id,
    name AS cluster_name,
    host_name,
    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date,
            hourly_daily.host_id,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 2
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 3
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
            SUM 
                (
                    CASE
                        WHEN hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            THEN COALESCE ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END
                ) AS uptime_mins,
            SUM ( hourly_daily.minutes_in_status ) AS total
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS hourly_daily
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        hourly_daily.host_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the datacenter chosen by the user
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id in ($cluster_id)
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest clusters configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters AS a
                        GROUP BY a.cluster_id
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( b.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts AS b
                        GROUP BY b.host_id
                    )
            -- This will determine if deleted hosts will be included in the report,
            -- according to the user selection for "show_deleted" parameter
            AND
                CASE
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes'
                        THEN 1=1
                    WHEN '$show_deleted'='No'
                        THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date isnull
                END
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id,

WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')

    host_name
ORDER BY

        CASE
            WHEN delete_date IS NULL
                THEN 0
            ELSE 1
        END
    ) ASC,
    CAST ( AVG ( uptime_mins ) AS float ) / CAST ( AVG ( total ) AS float ) DESC

-- SL01-11 - This query returns the

    delete_date,
    AVG ( unplanned_downtime_mins ) AS unplanned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( planned_downtime_mins ) AS planned_downtime_mins,
    AVG ( total ) AS total
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms.cluster_id,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_name AS name,
            v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date,
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id,

                (
                    CASE

                            THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                        ELSE 0
                    END

panels.title: Downtime by Virtual Machine (SL01-12)

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( datacenter_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN datacenter_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.datacenter_id 	         				
            ) 	 			
    AND datacenter_id  	         			    
        IN 			     				    
            ( 					 						
                SELECT DISTINCT datacenter_id 					 						
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters 					 						
                WHERE  					     						    
                    cluster_id 					         						        
                        IN 					             						            
                            ( 									 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 									 										
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms  								 									
                            ) 						    
                    OR cluster_id  						        
                        IN 						            
                            ( 										
                                SELECT DISTINCT cluster_id 										
                                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts 									
                            ) 					
            ) 	 			
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					    
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END

                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date ISNULL 	    			
        END     		
    AND datacenter_id IN ($datacenter_id)
